body:
Since about the weekend my spack install seems to be broken. Probably something with the init, maybe caused by #7774?

Even cloning the repo from scratch and removing my local configs keeps the error.

### Expected Result

Usage as before

### Actual Result

Build system (parent class) of packages is not found.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```bash
$ spack install hdf5
==> Error: name 'AutotoolsPackage' is not defined
$ spack install py-pybind11 ^python@3
==> Error: Invalid Version range: 3.4:3
$ spack install cuda
==> Error: name 'Package' is not defined
```

### Information on your system

Spack `develop`: 3712ac1f663a0c06765daced44f6a4e2f986c9f4

```
$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Debian
Description:	Debian GNU/Linux 9.4 (stretch)
Release:	9.4
Codename:	stretch

$ uname -a
Linux ax3l 4.9.0-5-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.65-3+deb9u2 (2018-01-04) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
title: ==> Error: name 'Buildsystem' is not defined
